He is a veteran of Operation Enduring Freedom and received the Joint Service Achievement Medal for his work as a Spanish linguist for the Defense Intelligence Agency in 2005. William graduated from Campbell University in 2007 with a degree in computer science. He earned his J.D. in 2011 from the North Carolina Central University School of Law. His practice areas include immigration law and criminal defense cases. He is licensed and in good standing with the State Bar of North Carolina and a member of the American Immigration Lawyer Association (AILA.) He is a proud member of the Charlotte community and provides compassionate counsel for all his clients.

itemListElement.name: Can a lawyer help me if i get a dwi

content.mainContent:
Driving while intoxicated by drugs or alcohol is something that few people would admit to doing. However, studies suggest as many as one in four people have driven under the influence of alcohol or other substances. Some DWI arrests are the result of a poor decision while other times, faulty breath testing devices or other issues lead to an unjustified DWI arrest.

If you were charged with driving while intoxicated (DWI), you may also be very nervous about the consequences you face for your actions. While this is natural, it is also important to know that the legal consequences for something like a DWI are rarely set in stone. The advocacy of a great attorney can help you fight the charges and possibly even get them dropped.

What Can an Attorney Do in My Defense?

Depending on the facts of the case, an attorney has several options available for fighting the charges. These include, but are not limited to:

  • Questioning the validity of a breathalyzer result
  • Questioning the validity of the roadside test (if the officer asked you to walk in a straight line, count backward from 100, etc.)
  • Questioning the officer’s justification for pulling you over in the first place
  • Questioning the chain of custody of any evidence
  • Arguing that you are a first-time offender with no criminal history

Using one or more of these strategies could result in the following actions:

  • Convincing the prosecutor not to file charges, or to drop charges if already filed
  • Reducing the charges you face
  • Negotiating a plea deal that allows you to stay out of jail or not go to trial

It is important to note that no outcome can be definitively guaranteed, but your prospects of avoiding harsh punishment are much higher with the help of an experienced attorney who knows local judges and prosecutors.

For example, many prosecutors are willing to enter into plea deals for DWI cases, especially for first-time offenders. In exchange for a guilty plea and/or the promise to attend substance abuse counseling, you may receive a greatly reduced sentence or charge dropped from a DWI to a reckless driving. This may allow you to keep your driver’s license, pay lower fees, or avoid jail time.

Contact a Raleigh, NC DWI Defense Lawyer

Facing charges of a DWI can be scary, but having a tough, experienced Wake County DWI attorney can help you get the charges reduced or dropped altogether. Get the help you need by calling Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC today at 1-844-YO-PELEO and schedule your free initial consultation. Hablamos Español.

Source:

https://www.ncdps.gov/our-organization/law-enforcement/state-highway-patrol/faq/driving-while-impaired
